sec.p: The mean diameter of the growth inhibition zone of E. faecalis in millimeter (based on the results of disc diffusion test) for PF, ZT, DM, FG, CHX %0.02, and Gentamycin was found to be 23, 25, 12, 18, 21, and 8 mm, respectively. The mean diameter of the growth inhibition zones in the well plate method for ZT showed that it had greater antimicrobial activity against E. faecalis than others. Furthermore, ZT and PF had higher antimicrobial activity than CHX.
